class h5database.database.database.Database(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: h5database.database.abstract_database.AbstractDB

generate_table_name(phase: str) → Tuple[str, str][source]¶

Override from AbstractDB. Define the output pytable name as database_name_phase.pytable :param phase: Phase of dataset, e.g. train or val. :type phase: str

Returns

Full file path of exported pytable given the phase. pytable_dir (str): The export dir of pytable

Return type

pytable_full_path (str)

get_files() → Sequence[str][source]¶

Default behavior getting the source files: get the list of files matching the pattern under the file_dir. :returns: Full paths of all selected source files. :rtype: files (Sequence[str])

init_split(stratified_labels=None)[source]¶

Initialize the data split and shuffle using K_fold. If labels are given, using stratified K-fold to preserve the label balance in each split. :param stratified_labels: A sequence of labels. Default is None. :type stratified_labels: Sequence

Returns

File split (specified by file_id in the file_list) per phase.

Return type

splits (Dict[str, np.ndarray])

initialize(force_overwrite=False)[source]¶

Write files to the new database, if the database is not already created, unless specify the force_overwrite as True :param force_overwrite: Whether overwrite the pytables if they already exist. Default is False. :type force_overwrite: bool

Returns:

is_instantiated(phase)[source]¶

Return false if no hdf5 found on the export path. :param phase: Phase of the pytable, e.g. train. :type phase: str

Returns:

parse_types(shape_dict: Dict[str, Tuple[int, ...]] = None) → Sequence[str][source]¶

Override from the superclass. Extract the name of data_types from the given shape_dict. If shape_dict is not None, then the types are given by its keys. Otherwise use the pre-defined train_name and val_name property. :param shape_dict: Name-Value pair of <type, shape>. Default is None. :type shape_dict: Dict[str, Tuple[int, …]]

Returns

Sequence of the names of types.

Return type

type_names (Sequence[str])

peek(phase) → Tuple[source]¶

Peek the shape of items given phase. :param phase: Phase of pytable. :type phase: str

Returns

Shape of data for each type given the phase.

Makedir if the pytable_dir does not exist. :param pytable_dir: Target directory. :type pytable_dir: str

Returns:

refresh_atoms()[source]¶

Recreate the self._atoms using _init_atoms. :returns: Dict of atoms per data type. :rtype: self._atoms (Dict[str, tables.atom])

Size of the pytable as number of rows (of h5array) given the phase. :param phase: Phase of the pytable. :type phase: str

Returns

H5Array Size as int.

build_patch_array(phase: str, category_type: str, atom: tables.atom.Atom, filters: tables.filters.Filters = None, expectedrows: int = None, group_level: int = None) → Dict[source]¶

Create H5array for extracted data. :param phase (): Phase Key. :param category_type (): Type name. :param atom (): Type of the atom for the array. :param filters (): Filter instance for the H5array :param expectedrows (): User Estimation of number of rows of the H5array. :param group_level (): Whether data are grouped. If 0: no grouping. If 1: group by source file, using VLarray.

Returns

write_data_to_array(phase, patches_dict, data_size=None)[source]¶
write_file_names_to_array(phase: str, file: str, patches: Dict[str, Any], category_type: str = 'filename')[source]¶

Write the source filename of a group of corresponding extracted data to an h5array, given the phase and type. Perform write-in if only patches is not None, and each type name of “patches” is defined in the database. :param phase (): Phase key. :param file (): Full filename :param patches (): Extracted data. :param category_type (): Type name of this field. Default “filename”

Returns:

is_count_weight()[source]¶

Validate Weight Collection should be performed. :returns: True only if the “enable_weight” field in the associated database obj is true, and class names are defined.

property totals¶

Returns: The cached class counts.

weight_accumulate(file: str, type_names: Sequence[str], patch_group: Dict[str, object], extra_information: Any)[source]¶

A wrapper to accumulate class count, if is_count_weight is validated, given the callable that defines the behavior of weight accumulation. :param file (): Filename. :param type_names (): Type names defined in the dataset. :param patch_group (): Extracted data of all types from the source file. :param extra_information (): Any extra parameters to pass.

Returns:
